intro: Mentzelia pectinata var. chrysopetala, commonly known as the golden cupplant, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its distinctive, cup-shaped inflorescence that holds numerous small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The species is part of the Boraginaceae family and is known for its ornamental value and ecological importance to pollinators.
